titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of Advertisements that Depict American History
titlestmt.author: by Matthew Daniel Mason

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 07:13

did.unittitle: Collection of advertisements that depict American history.

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: This collection consists of collecting cards, advertising cards, sticker books, sheet music, and printed ephemera that document popular culture images of the United States and North America as viewed chiefly by countries throughout Europe, including France, Great Britain, Belgium, Germany, and Italy. The collection provides depictions of American subjects and themes from primarily European viewpoints used by companies to advertise their products or as premiums accompanying products. Subjects particularly well represented include Indians of North America and the American West, as well as natural landscapes and historical events, such as national parks and the American Civil War. Prominent individuals represented in the collection include United States presidents, particularly George Washington and Abraham Lincoln, and historical figures including Daniel Boone, Sitting Bull, Kit Carson, and Wyatt Earp.

langmaterial.language: In English, Italian, German, French, and Dutch.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Title devised by cataloger.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This is an open collection to which additions are expected. Consequently, it is organized by accession, with the contents of each accession arranged in parallel fashion.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Kevin Jackson on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2009-2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Collection of Advertisements that Depict American History is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Popular Culture Images of American History. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This is an open collection to which additions are expected. Consequently, it is organized by accession, with the contents of each accession arranged in parallel fashion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of collecting cards, advertising cards, sticker books, sheet music, and printed ephemera, which document popular culture images of the United States and North America as viewed chiefly by countries throughout Europe, including France, Great Britain, Belgium, Germany, and Italy. Overall, the collection provides depictions of American subjects and themes used by companies to advertise their products. Images in the collection provide especially rich representations of Indians of North America and the American West, as well as natural landscapes and historical events, such as national parks and the American Civil War. Prominent individuals represented in the collection include United States presidents, particularly George Washington and Abraham Lincoln, and historical figures, including Daniel Boone, Sitting Bull, Kit Carson, and Wyatt Earp.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. 2009 Acquisition, circa 1870-1988. II. 2010 Acquisition, 1870-1994.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in five subseries: Collecting Cards, Advertising Cards, Sticker Books, Sheet Music, and Printed Ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of collecting cards, advertising cards, sticker books, sheet music, and printed ephemera, which document popular culture images of the United States and North America, and the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library acquired in 2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by company and then chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collecting cards issued singly or in sets. Some cards include advertising or accompanied a product as a premium.
